comments.raw_text:
In case an admin doesn't go to the home page or hasn't logged in a quite some time for wheatever reason, Bugzilla should periodically check in the background for updates and email the admin if any are available.

This could be done by using one of the current background scripts such as whine.pl, collectstats.pl, etc. or something else

The frequency that the system checks should be configurable as a param.

dkl

comments.text: This is WONTFIX, IMO. We should rather have a bugzilla-announcement@ mailing-list to which everyone is free to subscribe and which would only get Release Announcements, meaning that other subscribers wouldn't be allowed to send emails to this list, only the Bugzilla core developers involved in the release stuff.

(In reply to Byron Jones ‹:glob› from comment #5) 
> perhaps we could make the discoverability of the announce list higher by
> including a reference to it on post-install page.

I would be fine with that as well. We just need to somehow make it more obvious how admins
are notified of updates. Requiring them to login to the home page from time to time is not fool-proof and even then it may be some time after the actual release has happened leaving them vulnerable during that time.

dkl
